page.title: 07Gravel Extraction, Lound
page.content: Many big companies such as A.R.C., Redland and Tarmac quarry in the local area. The quarries make sand and gravel. Many acres of ground in this area are quarried every year. About two hundred and fifty local people are employed in the quarrying business. Some people drive the lorries and some people work in the offices. When they have finished quarrying they restore some of the ground. It is then used again for agriculture. All the sand and stone goes into making ready mixed concrete, tiles, bricks and asphalt. Limestone from Derbyshire and granite from Leicestershire are also used with the sand. Draglines, loading shovels and dumpers are used in the quarries. The quarries are dangerous and have high fences around them to keep out children. There are some areas of quicksand.
